name: Sprouted Chickpea Hummus
description: I like to make this hummus with raw chickpeas. It's a nice change from classic chickpea hummus. The rawness comes through as a fresh flavor that is not at all harsh. My husband describes it as "wheatgrass-y," which he promises...
recipeIngredient: 2 cups sprouted chickpeas, raw or cooked
1 to 1 ½ teaspoons Kosher salt (to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Place the chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, and garlic in the bowl of a food processor. Pulse until well-processed.
Through the feed tube, drizzle in the olive oil while the food processor is running.
Salt to taste. Serve immediately or refrigerate.
